visual_elements.description: Figure 17, titled 'Setbacks for oddly shaped lots', which contains a key and seven diagrams (A-G) illustrating different types of oddly shaped lots and their setback considerations.
visual_elements.location: Top to bottom, spanning the entire width of the page

visual_elements.description: Key for the diagrams, defining symbols for Curb (solid line), Lot line (dashed line), Sidewalk (hatched rectangle), Required setbacks (thin dashed line), and Buildable area (light gray shaded area).

Diagram A: 'Flag lot'. Shows a lot with a narrow access strip to the street. The 'Front lot line' is identified as the one closest and most parallel to the street. A 'Front setback' of 10' is indicated instead of 20'. The lot has a 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', and 'Interior-side yards'.

Diagram B: 'Corner lot'. Shows a rectangular lot at a street corner. It has a 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', 'Interior-side yard', and a 'Streetside yard'. A setback of 16' is indicated from the streetside.

Diagram C: 'Substandard Corner lot w/frontage < 50''. Shows a corner lot with two street frontages. The 'Front lot line' is identified as the shortest of the two frontages. A 'Street side setback' of 10' is indicated instead of 16'. The lot has a 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', 'Interior-side yard', and a 'Streetside yard'. A 10' setback is shown from the shorter street frontage.
Diagram D: 'Through lot'. Shows a lot with street access on two opposite sides. It has a 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', and 'Interior-side yards'.

Diagram E: 'Wedge shaped lot'. Shows a pie-shaped lot with a curved street frontage. It is noted that 'Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines.' and 'The rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines.' The lot has a 'Front yard' and 'Interior-side yards'.
Diagram F: 'Lot with more than 4 sides'. Shows an irregularly shaped lot with multiple sides. It has a 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', and 'Interior-side yards'.

Diagram G: 'Lot with more than 4 sides'. Shows an L-shaped lot. It is noted that the 'Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.' The lot has a 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', and 'Interior side yard'.

technical_specifications.parameter: Rear yard determination radius (Wedge shaped lot)

structural_elements.main_heading: Determining setbacks on oddly shaped lots considerations
sections: Fig 17 Setbacks for oddly shaped lots
F Lot with more than 4 sides
G Lot with more than 4 sides

additional_notes: Page number '23' is present at the bottom right corner.

qualifiers.text: Front lot line is closest and most parallel to street.
Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.
Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines.
Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.

conditions.text: Street side setback is 10' instead of 16'
The rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines.
Rear lot line is farthest and most parallel to street.
conditions.threshold_value: farthest and most parallel to street

logical_relationships.expression: IF 'Front lot line is closest and most parallel to street.' THEN 'Front setback is 10' instead of 20''
IF 'Front lot line is shortest of the two frontages.' AND 'Substandard Corner lot w/frontage < 50′' THEN 'Street side setback is 10' instead of 16''
IF 'Wedge shaped lots don't have rear lot lines.' THEN 'The rear yard is determined by a 20' radius from intersection of side lot lines.'

execution_sequence.action: Identify the type of lot (Flag lot, Corner lot, Substandard Corner lot, Through lot, Wedge shaped lot, Lot with more than 4 sides).
For Flag lots (A), apply setback rule based on front lot line definition.
For Corner lots (B), apply standard streetside setback.
For Substandard Corner lots (C), apply specific streetside setback based on frontage.
For Wedge shaped lots (E), determine rear yard based on radius from side lot lines intersection.
For lots with more than 4 sides (G), identify rear lot line based on parallelism and distance to street.
